channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Black Friday design deals you don’t want to miss
item.description: After Thanksgiving, brands will bombard you with Black Friday and Cyber Monday promotions. It can be overwhelming to know what to buy. After all, some...

item.title: 7 Effective Ways to Level Up Your Leadership
item.description: In a world of constant change and disruption, business-as-usual just won’t cut it.

item.title: Money dysmorphia: Why solopreneurs fall prey to the funhouse mirror of finances
item.description: I’ve worked for myself for nearly a decade, and in all but one of those years I’ve earned more than the U.K. average salary. Some years it’s been a li...

item.title: The Louvre will hike prices for everyone who isn’t from Europe—from $25 to $37
item.description: Last year, the Louvre welcomed 8.7 millions visitors. 77% of them were foreigners.

item.title: 15 Surprisingly Good Black Friday Gift Ideas for the Tech Lover in Your Life
item.description: A few ideas to help you shop for the tech-loving friend or family member.

item.title: Trump says he wants to ‘permanently pause migration’ from poor countries: ‘Only reverse migration can fully cure this situation’
item.description: Donald Trump spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday railing against immigrants on social media.

item.title: This Startup Is Growing Mini-Livers to Keep Patients Alive
item.description: Dimension Bio wants to grow a simplified liver from cells to sustain patients long enough for a damaged liver to recover—or until a transplant arrives...

item.title: AI Is the New Employee and Colleague. Leaders Must Be Ready for the Change
item.description: In the future, the most successful leaders will treat AI as a part of the team.

item.title: Black Friday faces its ultimate test as desperate retailers and low consumer confidence collide in a high-stakes holiday standoff
item.description: "Consumers feel on edge," says Mastercard chief economist Michelle Meyer.

item.title: U.S. stocks lift on the last day of November as Wall Street eagerly awaits the results of Black Friday
item.description: Wall Street is operating on an abbreviated schedule Friday after being closed for the Thanksgiving holiday.

item.title: Spirits Industry Report Finds a Big Change in Gen Z’s Drinking Habits. Here’s What’s Driving It
item.description: New data from Bacardi Limited reveals consumers’ latest drinking patterns.

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott once needed her college roommate’s help with a $1,000 loan: ‘That’s just what you do for friends’
item.description: Years later, Scott repaid the favor when Jeannie Tarkenton started Funding U, a lending company that offers merit-based loans to low-income students.
